newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Electrolux says sees flat whitegoods sales in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Electrolux says sees flat whitegoods sales in 1997.

text.p: Swedish appliance maker Electrolux said on Wednesday sales volumes of whitegoods would be largely unchanged in the rest of 1997.
The company also said it expected a profit in its U.S. operations this year but saw no sign of a pick up in the German market, which accounts for about 30 percent of whitegoods sales in Europe.
"It is going to be approximately at these levels for the rest of the year," company chief executive Michael Treschow told a news conference.
"If it is anything besides unchanged it will be a little better," he added.
He said the biggest problem was Germany, where no upturn was seen.
"The biggest worry is Germany and we see no signs of improvement there. It does not just have to do with demand -- we also see a trend towards cheaper and cheaper goods," he added.
Operations in the U.S. looked better, however.
"I believe that we are going to make money on our U.S. operations this year and we have not done that for a long time," he said.
But U.S. whitegoods specifically was not making a profit he said, but added it was going significantly better.
Treschow said the group's total sales in July were good.
"The third quarter has begun with good sales volumes, especially in North America, but also in Europe with the exception of Germany," he said.
